description:
The primary objective of this module is to equip participants with the basic principles and concepts of structural stability for the analysis of civil engineering structures. Students will learn stability characteristics and design steel frames for local and global stability according to Eurocode 3 (EC3). The topics covered include general principles of stability, buckling of column, beamcolumn and frames. Students will also be taught how to deal with general stability problems of frames using computer applications and numerical formulation.

The module is targeted at post-graduate and senior under-graduate civil engineering students with a keen interest on stability analysis and design.
title: Structural Stability Concepts & Applications
